comments.body: Would it be possible (in the future) to adapt Scalafix rewrites to code actions so that it won't be necessary to define a `WorkspaceCommand` for each type of rewrite?

Scalafix absolutely, scalafix can run custom rules from configuration in .scalafix.conf, we can probably embed that config as command arguments to get away with only a single `Scalafix` WorkspaceCommand.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +11,15 @@  case object ClearIndexCache extends WorkspaceCommand
  case object ResetPresentationCompiler extends WorkspaceCommand
  case object ScalafixUnusedImports extends WorkspaceCommand

  val values = findValues

comments.body: I went for a `lowerCamelCase` convention here and thanks to `Uncapitalised` this is automatically handled by `withNameOption` and `entryName`
